data.title: What's On in May
data.meta_description: Let’s stay in touch if you want to keep up to date with the latest news, events and community stories from The West.
data.text:
Looking for great entertainment and community events?

Get ready to take part in a diverse range of events that showcase The West. From live performances to family-friendly festivals, there’s something for everyone to enjoy.

Mark your calendars and get ready for a fun-filled month ahead!

May Events

Bingo with Chantelle!

Love Bingo? On Monday nights, The Hangar can give you your fix with our super funny host Chantelle. Drink food special offers available and some great company.

Friday night at The Taphouse

Live music on Fridays from 7 pm at The Taphouse, Avondale with a rotating roster of Ruff Copy and Sosomai Crew. Check their Facebook Page events. https://www.facebook.com/avondaletaphouse/

DJ beats

Workshop Bar has DJs on Fridays from 7 pm. Included in the DJ rotation are Manchoo and Mike, along with special guest appearances. Check their Facebook page events here.

Music Saturdays

Live Music at The Good Home Lincoln Rd on Saturdays from 3 pm. There’s a great Kids Menu so all the family can come along and enjoy the music.

Saturday - Live Music Sessions

Live Music at iTi Drinks & Bites Garden on Saturdays and Sundays from 2 pm. Check the website for a calendar of artists. www.weareiti.co.nz (image Sunday Sessions with Eleanor)

DJ Manchoo

Mr Illingsworth, Te Atatū Peninsula – Vibe with DJ Manchoo on Sunday afternoons in Te Atatū from 1 pm. Playing all his signature mixes. A great way to catch on with friends on a Sunday with drink specials and tasty food.

Dance to relieve stress

Mind Your Body dance sessions focussed on relieving stress through movement run by Nruty Ambari Explore Performing Arts. During the school term at a choice of three different venues: New Lynn Community Centre, Tuesdays from 6 pm to 7 pm, Titirangi Community House, Wednesdays from 5:30 to 6:30 pm, and Avondale Community Centre, Saturdays from 10.30 am to 11.30 am. Register here.

The Big Bike Film Night 2024 - Avondale

The Hollywood Avondale | Wednesday, 1st May | 7:00 pm Showcasing a carefully crafted and curated collection of bike films that has everything a cycle-centric audience could want - action, drama, humour, and plenty of inspiration; the evening is unashamedly and utterly, utterly, utterly designed and devised for the two-wheel devotee!

Women’s Health Workshop

New Lynn Community Workshop | Thursday, 2nd May | 10:30 am Free Women’s Health Workshop to kōrero about all things Cervical Screening (Learn about the new HPV Self-Test), the HPV Vaccination, Menopause, Sexual Health and Family Planning (Contraception)

Hex Fight Series 30

The Trusts Arena | Saturday 4th May | 4:30 pm Australasia’s leading MMA fight show heads to The Trusts Arena on Saturday May 4th, 2024, for the very first time! The best talent the country has to offer, with titles on the line in high stakes matchups as the next crop of talent looks for UFC stardom!

Crown Lynn Collector’s Market

New Lynn Community Centre | Saturday, 4th May | 9am -1pm Save the date! The iconic Crown Lynn Collectors Market is back for another awesome day of treasure hunting! Now is the time to have a long look at your collection... what’s missing...? Or, maybe you’ve got a double or two you’d like to find a new home for...?

Quiz Night

Mr Illingsworth | Tuesday, 7th May | 7:00 pm A great night out for family & friends! Time to prove how smart you can be!

Music in the Library: Auckland Youth Symphonic Band

Avondale Library | Saturday, 11th May | 10:00 am Join the Auckland Youth Symphonic Band for a relaxing morning of music at Avondale Library. This is a free concert in celebration of @NZ Music Month, band plays at 10:15 am.
